listBibl.head: Selections from DHQ special issue on Project Resiliency (forthcoming)
listBibl.bibl: Holmes, Martin, Janelle Jenstad, and J. Matthew Huculak. Introduction to Special Issue: Project Resiliency in the Digital Humanities. Preprint
Battershill, Claire. The Stories We Tell: Project Narratives, Project Endings, and the Affective Value of Collaboration. Digital Humanities Quarterly, forthcoming. Preprint
Crompton, Constance. No Boutique or Fashionable Technologies: Project Development, Mentorship, and Sustainability in an Innovation-First World. Digital Humanities Quarterly, forthcoming. Preprint
Cummings, James. Academics Retire and Servers Die: Adventures in the Hosting and Storage of Digital Humanities Projects. Digital Humanities Quarterly, forthcoming. Preprint
Diamond, Sara. The Dangers of Disappearance, the Opportunities of Recovery. Digital Humanities Quarterly, forthcoming. Preprint
Thieberger, Nick. Doing it for Ourselves: The New Archive Built by and Responsive to the Researcher. Digital Humanities Quarterly, forthcoming. Preprint
Otis, Jessica. Follow the Money?: Funding and Digital Sustainability. Digital Humanities Quarterly, forthcoming. Preprint
Holmes, Martin, and Joey Takeda. From Tamagotchis to Pet Rocks: On Learning to Love Simplicity through the Endings Principles. Digital Humanities Quarterly, forthcoming. Preprint
Coble, Zach, and Jojo Karlin. Reference Rot in the Digital Humanities Literature: An Analysis of Citations Containing Website Links in DHQ. Digital Humanities Quarterly, forthcoming. Preprint

listBibl.head: Additional and Supplementary Readings
listBibl.bibl: Bleier, Roman. How to Cite this Digital Edition? Digital Humanities Quarterly, vol. 15, no. 3, 2021.
Broyles, Paul A. Digital Editions and Version Numbering. Digital Humanities Quarterly, vol. 14, no. 2, 2020.
Carlin, Claire. Endings: Concluding, Archiving, and Preserving Digital Projects for Long-Term Usability. KULA, vol. 2, no. 1, 2018.
Christen, Kimberly. Does Information Really Want to be Free? Indigenous Knowledge Systems and the Question of Openness. International Journal of Communication, vol. 6, 2012, pp. 2870–2893.

Czaykowska-Higgins, Ewa, Martin Holmes, and Sarah Kell. Using TEI for an Endangered Language Lexical Resource: The Nxaʔamxcín Database-Dictionary Project. Language Documentation & Conservation, vol. 8, 2014, pp. 1–37.
Earhart, Amy. What’s In and What’s Out? Traces of the Old, Uses of the New: The Emergence of Digital Literary Studies, University of Michigan Press, 2015, pp. 62–89.

Flanders, Julia. Jobs, Roles, and Tools in Digital Humanities. On Making in the Digital Humanities: The Scholarship of Digital Humanities Development in Honour of John Bradley, edited by Julianne Nyhan, Geoffrey Rockwell, Stéfan Sinclair, and Alexandra Ortolja-Baird, UCL Press, 2023, pp. 148–161.

Goddard, Lisa, and Dean Seeman. Negotiating Sustainability: Building Digital Humanities Projects that Last. Doing More Digital Humanities: Open Approaches to Creation, Growth, and Development, edited by Constance Crompton, Richard J. Lane, and Ray Siemens, Routledge, 2019, pp. 38–57.

Holmes, Martin, and Joey Takeda. Beyond Validation: Using Programmed Diagnostics to Learn About, Monitor, and Successfully Complete your DH Project. Digital Scholarship in the Humanities, vol. 34, supplement 1, 2019.
Pierazzo, Elena. What Future for Digital Scholarly Editions? From Haute Couture to Prêt-à-Porter. International Journal of Digital Humanities, vol. 1, no. 2, July 2019.
Risam, Roopika, and Alex Gil. Introduction: The Questions of Minimal Computing. Digital Humanities Quarterly, vol. 16, no. 2, 2022.
Rockwell, Geoffrey, Shawn Day, Joyce Yu, and Maureen Engel. Burying Dead Projects: Depositing the Globalization Compendium. Digital Humanities Quarterly, vol. 8, no. 2, 2014.

Stapelfeldt, Krista, Sukhvir Khera, Natkeeran Ledchumykanthan, Lara Gomez, Erin Liu, and Sonia Dhaliwal. Strategies for Preserving Digital Scholarship / Humanities Projects. The Code4Lib Journal, no. 53, May 2022.
Warwick, Claire, et al. Documentation and the Users of Digital Resources in the Humanities. Journal of Documentation, vol. 65, no. 1, Jan. 2009, pp. 33–57. .

Warwick, Claire. Interfaces, Ephemera, and Identity: A Study of the Historical Presentation of Digital Humanities Resources. Digital Scholarship in the Humanities, vol. 35, no. 4, Dec. 2022, pp. 944–971.

Wilson, Nicola, Claire Battershill, Helena Clarkson, Matthew N. Hannah, Illya Nokhrin, and Elizabeth Wilson Gordon. Digital Critical Archives, Copyright, and Feminist Praxis. Archival Science, vol. 22, no. 3, 2022, pp. 295–317.
